DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the current study was to examine Brief Behavioral Activation Treatment for Depressions (BATD) effectiveness, credibility, and acceptability with moderate to severly depressed inpatients. The study is a systematic replication of a randomized controlled trail from 2003, that provided initial support for BATD With inpatients. The current study compared BATD to Treatment as Usual in a randomized controlled trial.
DOC.brief_title: Brief Behavioral Activation Treatment for Depression With Inpatients
DOC.criteria: Moderate to severe depression (BDIII > 28 Points). Admission length of at least 3 days Evaluated to benefit from depression treatment by unit psychiatrist. Current psychotic disorder Previously diagnosis with psychotic disorder (including Bipolar disorder)
DOC.keyword: Brief Behavioral Activation Treatment for Depression
